headline: REPORT: State will force voters to show proof of citizenship in bid to crack down on fraud
author: DML News App

Wednesday, March 30, 2022
FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE
Historic Day: Arizona Enacts Law Requiring Citizenship to Vote
STATE CAPITOL, PHOENIX – State Representative Jake Hoffman today celebrated the enactment of HB 2492, legislation he sponsored that requires proof of U.S. citizenship.

Good for Arizona—electoral integrity is essential for democracy to work!#TheGreatAmericaShow
Arizona will require voters to prove citizenship and residency, angering activists https://t.co/Gc5xa7hy2g #FoxNews

This only effects a very small percentage of total voters, and even then, we actually grandfathered in all of those individuals who are already registered to vote that have some form of proof of citizenship on file.”
Promoted Content
Historic Day: Arizona Enacts Law Requiring Citizenship to Vote.

As the most reliable and balanced news aggregation service on the internet, DML News App offers the following information published by Fox News:
Arizona residents will now need to show proof of citizenship in order to vote in a presidential election, sparking anger from some activists.

#VoterID
STORY: Arizona will require voters to prove citizenship and residency after Governor Doug Ducey signs election bill https://t.co/D09GJLHlXQ
— iVoteArizona™ (@iVoteArizona) March 31, 2022
Wouldn’t want to anger those lying, cheating left wing activists!

The article goes on to state the following:
The bill requires voters in presidential elections to show proof of citizenship, including by providing a driver’s license or tribal ID number, or a copy of a birth certificate, passport or naturalization documents.

Congratulations and thank you to State Rep Jake Hoffman (banned by twitter, badge of honor), whose bill to require proof of U.S. citizenship to vote in AZ is now law.

The bill also requires newly registered voters to show proof of address that they are an Arizona resident.
